GE.evidence:
https://www.start.io/audience/tiktok-users-in-georgia Tiktok has more than 166 000 Georgian users.

For App store it is the Second most downloaded app.

EG.evidence:
https://www.dailynewsegypt.com/2019/09/19/tiktok-marks-massive-success-in-egyptian-market/
Egypt, Saudi Arabia, and the UAE are the most three important markets for TikTok.
https://www.dailynewsegypt.com/2023/01/23/facebook-leads-social-media-platforms-in-egypt-followed-by-instagram-and-tiktok/
Facebook came in first place as the favourite social media platform in Egypt, followed by Instagram and TikTok. On the other hand, a mere 3.5% said they did not use Facebook at all, and 0.6% did not specify whether they used the platform. In second place came Instagram with 54.6% of respondents saying they use the popular social media platform. While TikTok secured the third spot with 45.7%.
EG.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Aksana Akhmedova

"Belarus-N1 in Top Grossing and N5 in free downloads

MN.answerer: Answered by Dulamkhorloo Baatar, and has been reviewed by Ani Kintsurashvili

MX.evidence: According to website "Data Reportal" TikTok is the fourth most popular social media in Mexico. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
MX.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Team Fundación Andrés Bello - Centro de Investigación Chino Latinoamericano

PA.evidence: According to TVN Media, TikTok is 4th most popular social media/messaging app, based on usage. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
PA.answerer: Answered by Alonso Illueca, and has been reviewed by Team Fundación Andrés Bello - Centro de Investigación Chino Latinoamericano

CR.evidence: Tik Tok, a social network developed and launched in China in 2016, ranks third, according to the Red 506 study by the media outlet El Financiero in conjunction with CAC Porter Novelli, 2022 edition. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "yes" response.
CR.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Team Fundación Andrés Bello - Centro de Investigación Chino Latinoamericano

PE.evidence: The Chinese social network TikTok is among the top 5 networks used by Peruvians, having strong growth at the time of the pandemic caused by SARS-CoV-2. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a “Yes” response.
PE.note: The consulting company Comscore specialized in marketing and the Reuters Institute for the Study of Journalism have been the ones that have carried out studies on the interaction of Peruvians with social networks. The National Institute of Statistics and Informatics, a specialized technical agency of the Peruvian government, to date has not prepared a study on the interaction of Peruvians with social networks. It should be noted that Facebook and Instagram are the favorite social networks in Peru.
PE.answerer: Answered by Jack Lo Lau and Jorge Jesús Chávez Ortíz, and has been reviewed by Team Fundación Andrés Bello - Centro de Investigación Chino Latinoamericano

VE.evidence: According to a poll made by the main newspaper in Venezuela, Últimas Noticias, about 45% of venezuelan people use TikTok. Therefore, this indicator dserves a "Yes" response.
VE.note: This poll was made online. For this reason its results could not be the most accuracy information, but for this China Index interaction UN poll was the only source that I could find to response this Indicator. In any case, the confidence rating is 60%.
VE.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Team Fundación Andrés Bello - Centro de Investigación Chino Latinoamericano

CL.evidence: Chile is the top 5 country in terms of social media consumption in 2023. According to a report by ENTEL Tik Tok is the 4th most used Social Media platform afted Whatsapp, Instagram, Facebook and Facebook Messenger, and has surpassed Twitter in terms of usage. In terms of total number of users, TikTok lies third after Youtube and Facebook and surpassing instagram, Linkedin and Twitter. Accordint to Datareportal. TikTok has 11.25 million Users in Chile. According to OOSGA, TikTok lies third in terms of users compared to the general population, after Facebook and Instagram. Hoiwever, this estimation was made with 2019 data. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
CL.answerer: Answered by Sascha Hannig Núñez, and has been reviewed by Team Fundación Andrés Bello - Centro de Investigación Chino Latinoamericano

EC.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
EC.answerer: Answered by Paúl Mena Mena, and has been reviewed by Team Fundación Andrés Bello - Centro de Investigación Chino Latinoamericano

CO.evidence: In Colombia, the TikTok platform ranks fifth in the most used social network applications during the year 2023. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
CO.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Team Fundación Andrés Bello - Centro de Investigación Chino Latinoamericano

BD.evidence: Facebook is the top social media platform in Bangladesh with 43.25 million users. Followed by are YouTube with 34.40 million users, Instagram with 4.45 million users, Facebook Messenger with 20.35 million users and LinkedIn with 5.90 million members. LT.evidence: According to the latest data, TikTok is among the five or six most popular social media/messaging apps in Lithuania, depending on the particular source. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Yes" response.

BG.evidence: TikTok has significantly increased its presence and popularity in Bulgaria since the last edition of the Index. According to usage statistics of most popular apps in Bulgaria from Google Play and Apple Store, TikTok is the second most popular platform after Facebook (in the "social" category") and it is the most popular on Apple Sotre (in the "entertainment category"). Therefore, this indicator deserves a yes response.
BG.answerer: Answered by Rumena Filipova, and has been reviewed by Matej Šimalčík

AT.evidence: According to a 2023 Statista survey, the five most used social media and messaging apps in Austria are: 1. WhatsApp 2. Facebook 3. Instagram 4. Facebook Messenger 5. TikTok. Tiktok is owned by Chinese company ByteDance. While TikTok is used by 30.2% of respondents, it ranks 4th among young Austrians (11-17 years old) with 65% of respondents using TikTok. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
AT.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by Alfred Gerstl

SG.evidence: WeChat, Little Red Book, Weibo, Zhihu, and TikTok are very popular in Singapore. TikTok has a broad base of users, especially among younger people. PRC-related or PRC-produced content on YouTube, Facebook, and Instagram is also widely consumed.

This indicator measures the "usage" of the apps instead of download numbers. However, if the respondent is certain about the usage but can't manage to find public data, then download numbers can be used as supporting evidence.

https://www.similarweb.com/top-websites/poland/computers-electronics-and-technology/social-networks-and-online-communities/

Mediascope states that TikTok has the highest average time spent in the app among its competitors. The Association of Communication Agencies of Russia (in Russian: АКАР) places TikTok in 5th place, noting that the overall top 5 list is undergoing changes due to sanctions.

PH.evidence: According to the 2023 Global Digital Report by Meltwater released this January, the top three social media apps most used in the country are Facebook (95.7%), FB Messenger (92.1%), Tiktok (77.2%), Instagram (71.9%), Twitter (56.7%). DE.answerer: Answered by Angela Stanzel, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

GB.evidence: TikTok appears in some surveys of the top five most popular social media apps in the UK, although the measures used (downloads, usage stats, reported 'favourites') to determine popularity vary. The usage of Tiktok also varies by age group.
GB.answerer: Answered by Leo Shaw, and has been reviewed by Sam Dunning and Andrew Yeh

AU.evidence: No publicly available evidence to support this claim in the affirmative.
AU.answerer: Answered by Leo Shaw, and has been reviewed by Kevin Mooney and Andrew Yeh

IL.evidence: A 2022 survey conducted by the internet content recommendation company Taboola and the information company Kantar Insights Israel found TikTok to be the fifth most popular app (24%), following WhatsApp (79%), Facebook (67%), Instagram (51%), and Telegram (27%).
IL.answerer: Answered by The Institute for National Security Studies (INSS), and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.
